page.title: 12WINDMILL-A RUIN
page.content: {HOLDERNESS MILLS}Easington village like many in Holderness had its own windmill (there are no running streams to provide power for watermills in these flat lands but there were plenty of strong windy days to push the sails round). {MILL TYPE}The mill was the "Tower Mill" type and had four white sails. It was painted black and had a white balcony surrounding the first storey. The mill was used to grind grain. {MILLERS.}In 1874 the millers were John and Miriam Cuthbert whose daughters were traginally killed following an accident at the Mill.Their graves are in the church cemetery with an interesting tombstone. { REMAINS}The mill is now a ruin with only the tower reduced in height remaining as a storeshed.
